author: parithosh
content:
It depends, it could if we change our processes a bit (and we will). Current process uses a mainnet deposit contract for shadowforks: https://sepolia.etherscan.io/address/0xa8a1cab7bd3db207a5e81b582dcf269e093fade4
It was deployed a while back and has just been reused since. 

The reason to use a fresh deposit contract is that any deposits or txs we make to it in the shadowfork couldn't ever in-advertantly leak into the main chain and cause issues on it. We also never really messed with the deposit behaviour since the beaconchain launched, so we never found a need to change the approach. 

Its clear the diffs with mainnet on our testnets has become unweildy and we will mod things to be as close to mainnet as possible in the future. However simply doing a shadowfork using our past standard would have missed this bug.
